fields.description:
Hi guys,

Please may I have an update/estimation on when Cosmos would be able to do this? (And, linked to that, the ability to place Future Published stories on pages.)

At a time when we are radically rethinking workflows and staff allocations for existing titles and Times Select, this is a central issue. Having an idea of when it might be possible (even if it's only months from now) will help us plan shifts and staff allocations.

For example, on a Sunday Times Saturday-night shift, it makes the difference between someone working until midnight or until 2am.
fields.summary: Update needed: ability to use Future Published article as related article links

fields.description:
From: Gary Griffiths 
Sent: 31 August 2016 9:46 AM
To: Brett Blakeway <blakewayb@timesmedia.co.za>
Cc: JJ Nortje <NortjeJ@timesmedia.co.za>
Subject: Tark Data Required- Tark3  

Hi Brett,
Can you create a table on tark and then fill it with the following data from the tark image table.

I need this info in a table so I can put it on my local pc for some investigation into cmyk and rgb images.

 

Required Fields from Tark Image Table.

Id

Path

PublicationId

EditionId

 

Thanks

Gary

fields.description:
What is the status of the TMG sport page? 
Please see a potential issue / challenge below: 
Hi Lisa, Reardon & team,

As you may be aware, Perform Media Channels Ltd (“Opta”) has licensed TEAMTalk Media Ltd (“TeamTalk”) to resell its data feeds, including those relating to the Premier League and English Football League in respect of which Opta is the official data partner.

We are writing to notify you that our relationship with TeamTalk may be coming to an end in the immediate future and, in such event, you will no longer be able to receive Opta data through your agreement with TeamTalk.
In light of the above, we are keen to work with you ensure that you continue to receive Opta data with minimal disruption, particularly as we approach a critical period of the European football season.

Please let me know when is a convenient time to discuss this further.

Kind Regards,
fields.summary: Status on the Sport pages / portal

Hi Jaco 

As discissed please see below copy for the email to be sent to all the users on the LRA System that have submitted entries.

20180131 LIBERTY RADIO AWARDS ENTRY CLOSED MAIL

Dear (NAME)

Thank you for demonstrating your commitment to radio excellence by entering the 2018 Liberty Radio Awards. Our records show that we have received the following entry/entries from you:

LIST OF ENTRIES GOES HERE

We are in the process of preparing the entries for the Adjudication Panel who will then listen to- and score- each entry so that on 14 April, we can announce the best-of-the-best at the Liberty Radio Awards Gala Banquet at the Sandton Convention Centre. 

Kind regards

Liberty Radio Awards

PS. Keep following the Liberty Radio Awards website (www.libertyradioawards.co.za) and our Facebook and Twitter feeds for updates

fields.description:
Project: Automated feed of all business content to INET/IRESS
Outline
INET and Iress have both expressed dissatisfaction at both the volume and nature of content that we are sending to them through the BDPro service. In an effort to increase the volume and quality of this content, we would like to send the content on the companies’ pages of Business Day to them early each morning. (6am-7am).

Brief
INET and Iress are providers of financial data. Their primary interest in Business Day copy is that it has the potential to move markets. Both data providers are primarily interested in companies and markets information. 
To this end: all pages in the print edition of Business Day are categorised by section, depending on their subject matter. The subject matter of interest to INET and Iress is on the pages in section “companies” and the non-puzzle content of Section BottomLine. The page numbers may vary, but the Section  will always remain Companies and BottomLine.
  
We would therefore need to:
i)	Isolate those pages
ii)	Isolate the content on those pages
iii)	Remove the puzzles
 
The remaining articles would then need to be copied, switched to a format suitable for sending to INET/Iress and sent off.
fields.summary: Automate sending of companies content to INET/IRESS

fields.description:
In a recent conversation with Percy it emerged that the Cosmos content-entry portal is still some way from completion. He asked that we build a solution such as the one we are using for Business Day/FM for The Times and Sunday Times.
So, we need a push-button solution for The Times -- I am not sure that the Sunday Times will ever be web-first, but let's extend the solution to work on that title too.
As with Business Day, the button needs to send individual articles together with any linked pictures to a Cosmos/Escenic ingestion folder (Percy to supply).
fields.summary: Push-button send-to-web for The Times/Sunday Times

fields.description:
Please find attached  the permissions instructions as promised.

I would suggest choosing one folder in the system which contains a document that a particular user is having Search issues with.  Review which user groups that individual user belongs to, and review what permissions have been granted on that document and that document's parent folder(s).  Make good any permission-deficiencies you find for that user by adding an appropriate group to that folder.  Also verify that the user belongs to the SharePoint group in question.

If you believe the user has the correct permissions to a document (and the proceeding folder structure) then you will need to provide the following details so that I may investigate further:
	1. The login name of the user who is unable to search for the document; and their password
	2. The name of the document, along with its folder location in the library


If you find a folder that has individuals rather than SharePoint groups assigned to the folder and decide that this is not a manageable situation going forward then you can revert the permission on that folder to inherit from its parent again.  See section 6. "Reverting Permissions back to Inheriting from Parent" for details on how to return an individual folder back to inheriting permissions.  I would also check the permissions on each folder above the folder in question, to see if inherited permissions has been disabled at different folder levels above.

If "permissions" prove to be the reason for the issues observed - then it might be worth considering restoring inherited permissions on ALL folders and starting from square one with your permissions-strategy, but this time using only SharePoint groups rather than a mixture of groups and individuals.
fields.summary: Review - Permissions instructions provided by Navatis

fields.description:
Hi JJ,

Thank you so much for meeting with us regarding a way forward with the Dolphin system.

As per your request, herewith my report.

As I mentioned in our meeting myself, Nadia and Michaele are using the system's basic search function. 

We have not been able to scan any new contracts since Esther left Times Media. Upon searching for contract content we found a number of contracts scanned with attachments missing.
There is also the question of an Audit function on the system this would be great as we can track any changes made to the content on the system.

I do believe the system is able to notify on contract expiry dates, this seems to be nonfunctional at this stage, if that could be looked into. The longevity of Gallo Music Business depends on timely renewals of existing contracts. We rely on memory and email notifications to prompt us on contract renewals.  We do have a handover document from Esther which we use to manage contract renewals, but as you are aware this can slip through the cracks, easily.
Please see attached email on error.

Based on above:
We would need comprehensive training and training material on how to operate the system correctly.
A detailed list/index on all GMP contracts currently on the system, by contract type?
Regarding the backlog, as suggested by yourself the  group Tiso Black Star Group, acquire the services of a person with a legal back ground to assist with this function.
A scanner to be linked to the Dolphin system.

Thank You

Best Regards,

Rene Bechor | Publishing and Royalties Manager Gallo Music Publishers SOUTH AFRICA HILL ON EMPIRE 16 Empire Road Parktown
Tel: +27 (0)11 340 9456  | Fax:+27 (0)11 280 3896
Email: reneb@gallo.co.za
fields.summary: Dolphin Contract system meeting update - Business Justification
